dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Blast furnace gas is produced during the iron oxide reduction in blast furnace iron making in which iron ore, coke and limestone are heated and melted in a blast furnace and is an indigenous process gas of the steelworks industry (Pugh et al., 2013). Blast furnace gas has a high carbon monoxide (CO) content and a low heating value, typical 3900 MJ/m3 (International Energy Agency, 2007). The five primary components of blast furnace gas are N2, CO, CO2, H2O and H2. The typical blast furnace gas composition in volume is N2 = 55.19%, CO = 20.78%, CO2 = 21.27% and H2 = 2.76% (Hou et al., 2011). The water content is removed by demisters following the cleaning process. This gas is used for the furnace mills, in gas engines and for electricity and steam generation. Often, in the steel industry, blast furnace gas is used as an accessional to natural gas (Bojic and Mourdoukountas, 2000). Blast furnace gas deposits adhere firmly; therefore, boilers using these type of fuel should be frequently cleaned.

高炉煤气产生于高炉炼铁过程中的氧化铁还原过程，即铁矿石、焦炭和石灰石在高炉中加热熔化的过程。高炉煤气一氧化碳（CO）含量高，热值低，一般为 3900 兆焦耳/立方米（国际能源机构，2007 年）。高炉煤气的五种主要成分是 N2、CO、CO2、H2O 和 H2。高炉煤气的典型体积成分为 N2 = 55.19%、CO = 20.78%、CO2 = 21.27%、H2 = 2.76%（Hou 等人，2011 年）。含水量在清洁过程后由除雾器去除。这种煤气可用于高炉轧机、煤气发动机以及发电和蒸汽。在钢铁工业中，高炉煤气通常被用作天然气的替代品（Bojic 和 Mourdoukountas，2000 年）。高炉煤气沉积物附着牢固，因此使用这类燃料的锅炉应经常清洗。
